gloss: (of a voice) faint / United States frontiersman who guided Fremont's expeditions in the 1840s and served as a Union general in the American Civil War (1809-1868) / a close-fitting woolen cap; often has a tapering tail with a tassel / a cry of approval as from an audience at the end of great performance / a decisive manner of beginning a musical tone or phrase / a strap attached to a hat; passes under the chin and holds the hat in place / an adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman) / an articulatory gesture made by turning the tip of the tongue back against the roof of the mouth / in or characteristic of a region of the United States north of (approximately) the Mason-Dixon line / normal reflex consisting of retching; may be produced by touching the soft palate in the back of the mouth / secure on a cleat / the act of nasalizing; the utterance of sounds modulated by the nasal resonators / the musical quality of the voice while singing / the sound made by the vibration of vocal folds modified by the resonance of the vocal tract / the sound of laughing
notation marking the end of principal parts of a musical composition; two adjacent bar lines
a cry of approval as from an audience at the end of great performance
the sound made by the vibration of vocal folds modified by the resonance of the vocal tract

a baroque musical composition (usually for a keyboard instrument) with full chords and rapid elaborate runs in a rhythmically free style / a vocal passage of narrative text that a singer delivers with natural rhythms of speech / an unaccompanied partsong for 2 or 3 voices; follows a strict poetic form
